intro: Diplazium nigrosquamosum, commonly known as the black-scaled water fern, is a species of fern native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its dark, scaly fronds that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its fronds are pinnately compound, with a distinctive dark coloration that helps in identification. Diplazium nigrosquamosum plays a role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
